variables.systemDescription:
This system is used to emulate the use of the link cable that allows two people to play two-player games on 2 Game Boys connected with the cable.
Only a limited list of titles are compatible.
The Game Boy Advance is a 32-bit handheld video game console developed, manufactured and marketed by Nintendo as the successor to the Game Boy Color. It was released in 2001. Nintendo's competitors in the handheld market at the time were the Neo Geo Pocket Color, WonderSwan, GP32, Tapwave Zodiac, and the N-Gage.
